Technical documentation¶

vk_requests.find_friends(name, list_friends)¶
async vk_requests.get_friends(access_token, user_id)¶
async vk_requests.get_id(api, screen_name)¶

Gets the user’s ID by short name

Parameters:

  • api – vkbottle.API

  • screen_name (str) – user ID or short name

Returns:

int

async vk_requests.link_processing(api, link)¶

Gets the user’s ID from the link to his page

Parameters:

  • api – vkbottle.API

  • link (str) – link to the user’s page

Returns:

int

async vk_requests.main()¶
vk_requests.print_ListOfDicts(l)¶

Makes a “beautiful” representation of the dictionary list

Parameters:

l (list) – list of dictionaries

Returns:

str

vk_requests.print_dict(d, indent=4, local_indent=0)¶

Makes a “beautiful” recursive representation of the dictionary

Parameters:

  • d (dict) – dictionary

  • indent (int) – the number of spaces in the indentation

  • local_indent (int) – the number of spaces, added to each line in the output

Returns:

str

vk_requests.required_fields_dict(d, fields='')¶

Make a new dictionary with fewer keys

Parameters:

  • d (dict) – dictionary

  • fields (str) – comma-separated field names other than “id,first_name,last_name,can_access_closed,is_closed,”

Returns:

dict

vk_requests.required_fields_list(l, fields='')¶

Calls a function required_fields_dict for each list item

Parameters:

l (list) – list of dictionaries

Returns:

list of dictionaries
